words.def: County/City (Proper noun)
a workman who laces shoes or footballs or books (during binding)
the state of being free of suspicion
peasant; fellow.
a unit of area (4840 square yards) used in English-speaking countries
the work of providing treatment for or attending to someone or something
A rude, rustic man; a churl.
a cord that is drawn through eyelets or around hooks in order to draw together two edges (as of a shoe or garment)
An anchovy or herring, especially pickled or dried.
any competition
a British peer ranking below a marquess and above a viscount
a rapid series of short loud sounds (as might be heard with a stethoscope in some types of respiratory disorders)
any rational or irrational number
British artist and writer of nonsense verse (1812-1888)
electrical conduction through a gas in an applied electric field
a motor vehicle with four wheels
A piece of celluloid on which has been drawn a frame of an animated film.
the smallest whole number or a numeral representing this number
resinlike substance secreted by certain lac insects
A recommendation or suggestion.
a unit of length of thread or yarn

A household or ancestral god in ancient Rome.
a period marked by distinctive character or reckoned from a fixed point or event
the sense organ for hearing and equilibrium
a unit of surface area equal to 100 square meters
a general name for beer made with a top fermenting yeast
The Indian mulberry , , especially as used to make dye.
a rare heavy polyvalent metallic element that resembles manganese chemically and is used in some alloys
a white soft metallic element that tarnishes readily
a trivalent metallic element of the rare earth group
angular distance above the horizon (especially of a celestial object)
a colorless and odorless inert gas
one.
